185864538.review:
One of the best games I've ever played. Lots of fun and joy there :)
It's very nice to play with friends. I like this kind of games but usually I stop playing them quickly, but not this one. This physic made me and my friends play it more and more.
Platformer + Race = Masterpiece

The only thing is that I'd bring more and more my friends to this game, but I can't do that since I played a lot and It can't be interesting to play together for both sides. I can play only with friends who I started playing with.
I'd be very happy to have more "balancing" characters which would be much harder to play as. Gold characters are very nice thing added to the game, but it's a solution when skill diference is not that big.
Characters with less speed by default, absence of bonuses and boost and stuff could be brilliant :)

185763929.review:
One of the most fun multiplayer games that I've ever played. While I may have 9 hours on Steam at the time of writing this, I had a lot more time on my console, so I can understand what I'm saying. 

The best way to experience this game is by playing with friends. The thrill of trying to survive against each other in a wide variety of maps with some optional modes is unforgettable, I still giggle whenever I think about some of the moments that I've had in this game with friends.

Quick Play can be pretty harsh, mostly everyone there has already developed the best techniques to gain high speeds in milliseconds so I did not have the best time in that mode, but I have found a few casual players every now and then that were fun to fight against.

The Campaign can be pretty thrilling to play. While yes, I was racing against bots, it managed to be pretty intense every time with Unfair mode. I go back to it sometimes, which I can't say for most of the games that I love in my library.

Basically, the best way to play this game is by playing with friends, Quick Play can often be hell, and the Campaign is very thrilling even if you are playing against bots. Would absolutely recommend getting this game if you see it on sale.

184054722.review:
Mariokart meets Super Mario Brothers.  It's not bad, but it didn't hold my interest.  
I thought about playing it with my kids, but I think it would be a big source of frustration for someone at all times, since I don't really think this would be at all forgiving to skill gaps - you don't even get to finish the race like you would in mariokart if you lose.  
It's a great idea, and winning feels good.  The levels seem decently made except for one or two spots that are too unforgiving, or allow too much advantage. I'd say 60% of the skill involved is having foreknowledge of the level, which I feel would make it really frustrating for newer players unless they all started the game together, and really only played together.  
That said, the playing itself is pretty fun, once you get a feel for swinging and wall jumping anyhow, both of which feel slightly off at first, especially wall jumping, but once you get how they want you to execute it, it's fine.
The game itself isn't bad, it just didn't click with me, and I don't see it being fun for my particular group due to skill gap.
